entities.trees

Class TDP_State_Node

  • java.lang.Object
    • entities.trees.TDP_State_Node

  • public class TDP_State_Node
extends Object
    A state-node in the state-space graph of T-DP constructed by DP_Problem_Instance.bottom_up(). Each state contains local information specific to the problem. For example, in join problems states represent database tuples. In T-DP, the stage of a node could have multiple children stages (i.e., branches). For each branch, we get a separate decision set and a separate optimal achievable cost. The overall minimum achievable cost is the sum of them. Important: the branches are indexed sequentially from 0 - those indexes are different than stage indexes.
    Author:
    Nikolaos Tziavelis

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      List<Double> branches_opt_cost
      A list of minimum achievable costs, one for each branch.
      List<TDP_DecisionSet> decisions
      All the decisions (edges) that can be made from this state, one set for each branch.
      List<Double> lawler_future_costs
      For Lawler in the space of subtree solutions (used by TDP_Recursive).
      int num_branches
      The number of stages below this node.
      int stage
      The stage of T-DP the node belongs to.
      Object state_info
      Holds local information about the state, depends on the T-DP problem.
      private Double subtree_opt_cost
      The optimal achievable cost starting from this node and traversing its subtree.

    • Constructor Detail

      • TDP_State_Node

        public TDP_State_Node(int stage,
                      int num_branches,
                      Object info)
        Creates a new T-DP state. Initially, we don't know the possible decisions and there is no way to reach the final state(s). Thus, the cost of all branches is infinite.
        Parameters:
        stage - The T-DP stage that the state belongs to.
        num_branches - The number of stages below this state.
        info - Local state information.

    • Method Detail

      • add_decision

        public void add_decision(int branch,
                         TDP_State_Node resulting_state,
                         double immediate_cost)
        Adds a decision (edge) to the pool of possible ones in the specified branch. This decision incurs some immediate cost given as parameter. If we follow the new decision from this state, we end up in resulting_state. If the minimum achievable cost with this decision is better than the current one, updates the best decision and the optimal cost in this branch.
        Parameters:
        branch - The branch that the decision belongs to.
        resulting_state - The state we end up if we follow the new edge-decision.
        immediate_cost - The cost we have to pay to follow the new edge-decision.

      • share_decisions

        public void share_decisions(TDP_State_Node other_state,
                            int branch)
        Makes this state share the same decisions with another state in the specified branch. Important: the decisions of each state-node can be different in each branch (e.g. for join queries, join attribute values are different across branches). Hence, we only share a specific branch. Use only after the other state has finished adding decisions.
        Parameters:
        other_state - The state whose decisions will be copied to this one.
        branch - The branch to be shared.

      • get_best_child

        public TDP_State_Node get_best_child(int branch)
        Returns the best child (state-node) in a specific branch we can hop to from the current state-node.
        Parameters:
        branch - A branch of the current node.
        Returns:
        TDP_State_Node The child that incurs the minimum achievable cost for the specified branch.

      • get_best_children

        public List<TDP_State_Node> get_best_children()
        Returns the best children (state-nodes) from all branches we can hop to from the current state-node.
        Returns:
        List A list of the children that incur the minimum achievable cost (one for each branch) or an empty list if this node belongs to a leaf stage.

      • get_best_decision

        public TDP_Decision get_best_decision(int branch)
        Returns the best available decision from this state for a particular branch.
        Parameters:
        branch - A branch of the current node.
        Returns:
        TDP_Decision The best decision in that branch.

      • get_decisions

        public ArrayList<TDP_Decision> get_decisions(int branch)
        Returns the decisions that can be taken from this state for a particular branch (that can lead to leaf stage nodes).
        Parameters:
        branch - A branch of the current node.
        Returns:
        ArrayList The admissible decisions for the branch.

      • get_subtree_opt_cost

        public double get_subtree_opt_cost()
        Returns the minimum achievable cost starting from this state. It is computed on-demand and then stored to avoid summing up multiple times during the bottom-up phase.
        Returns:
        double The minimum achievable cost starting from this state

      • set_to_terminal

        public void set_to_terminal()
        Sets the minimum achievable cost from this node to 0. Use to set the cost of leaf nodes.

      • get_children_of_one_branch

        public ArrayList<TDP_State_Node> get_children_of_one_branch(int branch)
        CAUTION: expensive because it allocates a new list.
        Parameters:
        branch - A branch of the current node.
        Returns:
        ArrayList The children in the specified branch that are capable of reaching the terminal state.

      • get_decision_cost

        public double get_decision_cost(TDP_State_Node child,
                                int branch)
        CAUTION: expensive operation, use only for debugging.
        Parameters:
        child - One of the children of this node.
        branch - The branch of the child.
        Returns:
        double The cost of a decision that leads to the specified child.
        If there is no such feasible decision, returns infinity.

        Overrides:

        Returns:
